MARCH 22, 2021
5:30 PM

MEETING

Monday, March 22, 2021

5:30 PM

Mayor Siddiqui

Mar 22, 2021

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a COVID-19
update on vaccination rollout.
CMA 2021 #48
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of a grant received from the Metropolitan Area Planning Council (MAPC) Accelerating Climate
Resiliency (ACR) Grant Program, in the amount of $52,250 to the Grant Fund Public Works Other
Ordinary Maintenance Account which will be used for technical assistance for 1) planning and
permitting the expansion of the floating wetland pilot in the Charles; 2) outlining and disseminating a
permitting road map and lessons learned that can enable similar capital, resiliency projects; and 3)
engagement with the wider community to support understanding of water quality and to inform the
expansion process.
CMA 2021 #49
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the Tree Protection Ordinance.
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE IN COUNCIL MARCH 22, 2021
CMA 2021 #50
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [8-1-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Toomey


PAGE 2

Mar 22, 2021

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to recommendations
for the block rates for water consumption and sewer use for the period beginning April 1, 2021 and
ending March 31, 2022.
CMA 2021 #51
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to suggested zoning
text amendments as well as amendments to Chapter 5.50 of the Municipal Code regarding cannabis
delivery businesses.
CMA 2021 #52
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE AND PLANNING BOARD
[9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 3

Mar 22, 2021

II. CALENDAR

ON THE TABLE
1. Resolution on the Death of William Leeds.
RES 2021 #5
Councillor Simmons, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Nolan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. Vaccinating CPS Staff Plan PO.
TABLED IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 3, 2021
POR 2021 #21
Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 3/29/2021 5:30 PM

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 20-64, requesting Home Rule language to allow for acoustic live
entertainment performances in small businesses under certain conditions without a license.
TABLED IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 22, 2021
CMA 2021 #32
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 3/29/2021 5:30 PM

4. An application was received from TD Bank, requesting permission for 4 (four) awnings at the
premises numbered 617 Massachusetts Avenue. Approval has been received from Inspectional
Services, Department of Public Works, Community Development Department and abutters.
APP 2021 #6
RESULT:
FAILED OF ADOPTION [4-4-1-0]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey

NAYS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan

PRESENT:
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler


PAGE 4

Mar 22, 2021

5. The Health & Environment Committee met on October 13, 2020 to discuss amending the Tree
Protection Ordinance based on the findings of the Urban Forest Master Plan Task Force.
TABLED IN COUNCIL MARCH 1, 2021 BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [8-1-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Toomey

6. The Health and Environment Committee met on November 10, 2020 to continue discussing
amending the Tree Protection Ordinance based on the findings of the Urban Forest Master Plan
Task Force.
TABLED IN COUNCIL MARCH 8, 2021 BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [8-1-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Toomey

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
7. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections.
PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 3/29/2021 5:30 PM

Mar 22, 2021

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Samantha Nardone representing Boston Properties, requesting
permission for a (5) five temporary banners across Main Street announcing Kendall Center Brand
thru October 1, 2021.
APP 2021 #10
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. An application was received from Brian Walsh, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises
numbered 75 Smith Place; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic,
Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No response has been
received from the neighborhood association.
APP 2021 #11
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 6

Mar 22, 2021

IV. COMMUNICATIONS
1. A communication was received from Emma Hartswick, regarding seeking update on safe shelter and
affordable housing.
COM 157 #2021
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. A communication was received from Judy Stitt, regarding complete and transparent forensic audit of
our election process.
COM 158 #2021
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

Mar 22, 2021

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Resolution on the death of Frances Babalas.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2021 #76
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. Thanking the Cambridge Historical Society for COVID-19 Butterfly Memorial
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey and entire
membership.
RES 2021 #77
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

3. A Resolution recognizing Peter Gately and Leon Cantor on their commitment to making our
community a better place
Councillor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2021 #78
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

Councillor Toomey and entire membership.

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor

Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

Councillor Toomey and entire membership.

RESULT:

Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Zondervan and
entire membership.
RES 2021 #81
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:

Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

Mar 22, 2021

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. Opposing wood-burning biomass plants
POR 2021 #53
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. In Support of the FARE Act
POR 2021 #54
Vice Mayor Mallon, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

3. Making Remote Participation in City Council Meetings Permanent
POR 2021 #55
Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

4. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to confer with the Department of Equity and
Inclusion, the Economic Development Division of the Community Development Department, the
Purchasing Department, the Information Technology Department, and other relevant City
departments to provide an update on progress made towards including this information from the
Cambridge Minority Business Enterprise Program in the Open Data Portal
POR 2021 #56
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 10

Mar 22, 2021

5. Opposing The MBTA Service Cuts
POR 2021 #57
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor
Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

6. Policy Order to Light City Hall Red
POR 2021 #58
Councillor Simmons, Vice Mayor Mallon, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
